TEXT.id: PaiwanCh2_011_THE HUSBAND KILLED BY HIS WIFE
TEXT.citation: Early, R. J., & Whitehorn, J. (2003). One hundred Paiwan texts. Pacific Linguistics, Research School of Pacific and Asian Studies, The Australian National University.
TEXT.BibTeX_citation: @book{100paiwantexts, author = {Robert Early and John Whitehorn}, title = {One Hundred Paiwan Texts}, year = {2003}, publisher = {Pacific Linguistics, Research School of Pacific and Asian Studies, The Australian National University}}
TEXT.source: vaław a uqałay a qintsi nua vavayan (Qatsiłay village, p.173)

S.FORM: uzai a marevaław ka sitsuayan a napenaulaulain.
ozai a marevaljaw ka sicoayan a napenaolaolain.
S.TRANSL: Once upon a time there was a married couple in great distress.

S.FORM: qau nekanga nu muri kanen.
qao nekanga no mori kanen.
S.TRANSL: They had nothing to eat.

S.FORM: qau "kemudanga itjen?" aya tiamadju.
qao "kemodanga itjen?" aya tiamadjo.
S.TRANSL: “What are we to do?” they said.

S.FORM: "maya sika neka nu tja kitanen.
"maya sika neka no tja kitanen.
S.TRANSL: “This way we’ve got no way of earning.

S.FORM: nangaq a vaik aken a sema tjua małaqałan," aya azua vaław a uqałay.
nangaq a vaik aken a sema tjoa maljaqaljan," aya azoa valjaw a oqaljay.
S.TRANSL: I had better go to another place,” said the husband.

S.FORM: qau vaik, sa tsuatsuay ini pangtjez anga i tjumaq.
qao vaik, sa coacoay ini pangtjez anga i tjomaq.
S.TRANSL: So he went away, and for a long time he didn’t come home.

S.FORM: manu uzai a uqałay a lemulutjuk tazua vaław a vavayan.
mano ozai a oqaljay a lemolotjok tazoa valjaw a vavayan.
S.TRANSL: A man tempted the wife.

S.FORM: "kudain a ini pangtjez anga a su vaław a tjaisangas.
"kodain a ini pangtjez anga a so valjaw a tjaisangas.
S.TRANSL: “What about your former husband who hasn’t come back?

S.FORM: nangaq a timitjanga a marevaław.
nangaq a timitjanga a marevaljaw.
S.TRANSL: Let us two live together.

S.FORM: anema su katjenglayan a matsidił?" ayain a kiłavaran a palayulayu.
anema so katjenglayan a macidilj?" ayain a kiljavaran a palayolayo.
S.TRANSL: Why do you want to live alone?” he kept saying.

S.FORM: "nangaq nu maya.
"nangaq no maya.
S.TRANSL: “All right then;

S.FORM: kudain a ini pangtjez anga a ku vaław a tjaisangas," aya azua vavayan.
kodain a ini pangtjez anga a ko valjaw a tjaisangas," aya azoa vavayan.
S.TRANSL: seeing that my former husband doesn’t come back,” said the woman.

S.FORM: qau makakełang anga a varung niamadju a maḍusa.
qao makakeljang anga a varong niamadjo a madrosa.
S.TRANSL: So the two of them agreed to it.

S.FORM: qau malap tua vava, sa alap tua katjutjung tu ḍusa; sa kevava tiamadju.
qao malap toa vava, sa alap toa katjotjong to drosa; sa kevava tiamadjo.
S.TRANSL: They got some beer and two bamboo cups, and drank together.

S.FORM: qau maka kevava tiamadju.
qao maka kevava tiamadjo.
S.TRANSL: When they had finished drinking,

S.FORM: taulan a vava katua katjutjung pi quluqulu.
taolan a vava katoa katjotjong pi qoloqolo.
S.TRANSL: they left the beer and cups at the head end (of the sleeping platform),

S.FORM: qau sa qereng tiamadju.
qao sa qereng tiamadjo.
S.TRANSL: and lay down.

S.FORM: manu mangtjez azua vaław a tjaisangas, sa setsevungi nua tsaḍ i djalan.
mano mangtjez azoa valjaw a tjaisangas, sa secevongi noa cadr i djalan.
S.TRANSL: The former husband came back, and met a thief along the way.

S.FORM: "ku katsuaw su kinatsu; pazuliułi aken tu lima iday," aya azua tsaḍ.
"ko kacoaw so kinaco; pazoliolji aken to lima iday," aya azoa cadr.
S.TRANSL: “I’ll carry your baggage; pay me 500,” said the thief.

S.FORM: "ui, katsuu nu maya; ku pazuliułay anga sun," aya azua vaław a tjaisangas a uqałay.
"oi, kacoo no maya; ko pazolioljay anga son," aya azoa valjaw a tjaisangas a oqaljay.
S.TRANSL: “All right; carry it then; I’ll pay you,” said the former husband.

S.FORM: qau katsuin nua tsaḍ a pasa tjua tapaw nimadju.
qao kacoin noa cadr a pasa tjoa tapaw nimadjo.
S.TRANSL: So the thief carried the things to the man’s house.

S.FORM: mintu kevavavava azua vaław a vavayan katua uqałay a zuma.
minto kevavavava azoa valjaw a vavayan katoa oqaljay a zoma.
S.TRANSL: The wife and the other man were drinking.

S.FORM: qau taulan nua tsaḍ pagału azua nanemanemanga.
qao taolan noa cadr pagaljo azoa nanemanemanga.
S.TRANSL: The thief put everything down gently;

S.FORM: qau a tsaḍ: "nangaq kiqiła ken imaza iqumaqan.
qao a cadr: "nangaq kiqilja ken imaza iqomaqan.
S.TRANSL: and he said: “I’ll hide here in the back of the house.

S.FORM: qau nu taqed tiamadju, tsemakaw anga ken tua nanemanemanga, sa ku kavilad anga nusauni," aya timadju.
qao no taqed tiamadjo, cemakaw anga ken toa nanemanemanga, sa ko kavilad anga nosaoni," aya timadjo.
S.TRANSL: When they go to sleep, I’ll steal everything, and then escape later,” he said.

S.FORM: qau kiqiła itjua misulemaleman.
qao kiqilja itjoa misolemaleman.
S.TRANSL: And he hid in the dark.

S.FORM: qau inika tsuay mangtjez azua vaław a tjaisangas.
qao inika coay mangtjez azoa valjaw a tjaisangas.
S.TRANSL: Soon the former husband came.

S.FORM: manu patjarakełang azua vaław a tjaivilił a uqałay tu muri mangtjez azua vaław a tjaisangas.
mano patjarakeljang azoa valjaw a tjaivililj a oqaljay to mori mangtjez azoa valjaw a tjaisangas.
S.TRANSL: The second husband got to know that the former husband was coming.

S.FORM: qau migatsał sa vaik a sema patekuteku tua taqtaq.
qao migacalj sa vaik a sema patekoteko toa taqtaq.
S.TRANSL: He got up and went under the sleeping platform.

S.FORM: qau mangtjez azua vaław a tjaisangas a uqałay.
qao mangtjez azoa valjaw a tjaisangas a oqaljay.
S.TRANSL: The former husband arrived.

S.FORM: qau nataqed anga azua vavayan.
qao nataqed anga azoa vavayan.
S.TRANSL: The woman was asleep,

S.FORM: qau tegain anga nazua vaław a tjaisangas azua vavayan.
qao tegain anga nazoa valjaw a tjaisangas azoa vavayan.
S.TRANSL: but the former husband woke her up.

S.FORM: qau patseged azua vavayan.
qao paceged azoa vavayan.
S.TRANSL: She woke up,

S.FORM: "aku uzai a vava katua katjutjung imaza?" ayain a vavayan.
"ako ozai a vava katoa katjotjong imaza?" ayain a vavayan.
S.TRANSL: and he said to her: “Why is there beer and cups here?”

S.FORM: "ui angata.
"oi angata.
S.TRANSL: “Oh well,

S.FORM: nu keman aken, ku sipazekazekatj sun a palayulayu," aya maitazua a kiłavaran azua vavayan.
no keman aken, ko sipazekazekatj son a palayolayo," aya maitazoa a kiljavaran azoa vavayan.
S.TRANSL: when I eat I always put some out for you too,” the woman just said.

S.FORM: qau pałeteku azua vavayan, sa kevava tiamadju.
qao paljeteko azoa vavayan, sa kevava tiamadjo.
S.TRANSL: The woman set out the beer (on a table), and they drank.

S.FORM: qau talavan tua vava azua uqałay; mapulaw aravats; maipuq anga.
qao talavan toa vava azoa oqaljay; mapolaw aravac; maipoq anga.
S.TRANSL: The man got full up with beer, got very drunk, and fell down.

S.FORM: qau azua tsaḍ katua vaław a tjaivilił a uqałay, avan tazua kevavavavanan a maḍusa, nakiqiła i patekuteku tua taqtaq a maḍusa itjua misulemaleman.
qao azoa cadr katoa valjaw a tjaivililj a oqaljay, avan tazoa kevavavavanan a madrosa, nakiqilja i patekoteko toa taqtaq a madrosa itjoa misolemaleman.
S.TRANSL: The thief and the second husband, while these two were still drinking, were both hidden under the sleeping platform in the dark.

S.FORM: manu uzai a djurikuku i taladj tua taqtaq.
mano ozai a djorikoko i taladj toa taqtaq.
S.TRANSL: There was a cockerel under the platform.

S.FORM: manu sakutsin nua tsaḍ; zemaing.
mano sakocin noa cadr; zemaing.
S.TRANSL: When the thief moved it, it crowed.

S.FORM: qau marekutj tu djumaken azua tsaḍ.
qao marekotj to djomaken azoa cadr.
S.TRANSL: The thief was afraid of being found.

S.FORM: "ła quluqulu aken," aya timadju.
"lja qoloqolo aken," aya timadjo.
S.TRANSL: “I’ll go to the head end,” he said.

S.FORM: mintu mapatsatsagtsag a qulu katu azua qulu na vaław a tjaivilił a uqałay.
minto mapacacagcag a qolo kato azoa qolo na valjaw a tjaivililj a oqaljay.
S.TRANSL: His head bumped into the head of the second husband.

S.FORM: qau azua tsaḍ: "aku uzai a tsautsau imaza?" aya azua tsaḍ.
qao azoa cadr: "ako ozai a caocao imaza?" aya azoa cadr.
S.TRANSL: “Why is there someone in here?” said the thief.

S.FORM: "nangaq a vaik aken a sema azua i tja iqumaqan a kiqiła," aya timadju.
"nangaq a vaik aken a sema azoa i tja iqomaqan a kiqilja," aya timadjo.
S.TRANSL: “I had better go and hide further into the house,” he said.

S.FORM: qau avan azua vaław uta tjaivilił a uqałay: "nangaq a vaik aken sema azua i tja iqumaqan a kiqiła," aya timadju.
qao avan azoa valjaw ota tjaivililj a oqaljay: "nangaq a vaik aken sema azoa i tja iqomaqan a kiqilja," aya timadjo.
S.TRANSL: And the second husband also was the same. “I had better go and hide further into the house,” he said.

S.FORM: manu izuanga tsaḍ a nakiqiła; matsatsagtsag anan a qulu.
mano izoanga cadr a nakiqilja; macacagcag anan a qolo.
S.TRANSL: The thief was hidden there, and they bumped heads again.

S.FORM: qau vaik azua tsaḍ uta a sema laukung.
qao vaik azoa cadr ota a sema laokong.
S.TRANSL: The thief moved again to the roof store-place.

S.FORM: azua vaław a tjaivilił a uqałay: "uzai a tsautsau imaza uta.
azoa valjaw a tjaivililj a oqaljay: "ozai a caocao imaza ota.
S.TRANSL: The second husband said: “There is someone here too.

S.FORM: nangaq a vaik aken a sema zua i laukung a kiqiła," aya.
nangaq a vaik aken a sema zoa i laokong a kiqilja," aya.
S.TRANSL: I had better go and hide in the roof store-place!

S.FORM: qau vaik.
qao vaik.
S.TRANSL: So he went there;

S.FORM: mintu mapatsatsagtsag anan a qulu uta.
minto mapacacagcag anan a qolo ota.
S.TRANSL: and they bumped heads once more.

S.FORM: "ii, aku uzai a tsautsau imaza uta?" aya zua tsaḍ.
"ii, ako ozai a caocao imaza ota?" aya zoa cadr.
S.TRANSL: “Ow! Why is there someone here too?” said the thief.

S.FORM: "masa namapełuq tua tsautsau tjua imaza," aya zua tsaḍ.
"masa namapeljoq toa caocao tjoa imaza," aya zoa cadr.
S.TRANSL: “This place seems to be full of people,” said the thief,

S.FORM: migergerger anga tua rekutjan.
migergerger anga toa rekotjan.
S.TRANSL: and trembled with fear.

S.FORM: manu mapulaw aravats aza vaław a tjaisangas a uqałay; qau taqed anga.
mano mapolaw aravac aza valjaw a tjaisangas a oqaljay; qao taqed anga.
S.TRANSL: Now the former husband was very drunk and asleep.

S.FORM: qau łekatsauan anga azua vaław a tjaivilił a uqałay.
qao ljekacaoan anga azoa valjaw a tjaivililj a oqaljay.
S.TRANSL: So the second husband emerged.

S.FORM: qau "muri kemuda sun?
qao "mori kemoda son?
S.TRANSL: “What are you going to do?

S.FORM: muri kamayan sun a puvaław tua su vaław a tjaisangas kemuda?" ayain azua vavayan.
mori kamayan son a povaljaw toa so valjaw a tjaisangas kemoda?" ayain azoa vavayan.
S.TRANSL: Are you going to carry on being married to your former husband, or what?” he said to the woman.

S.FORM: łakua "neka.
ljakoa "neka.
S.TRANSL: But the woman said: “No.

S.FORM: timitjayay anga a marevaław.
timitjayay anga a marevaljaw.
S.TRANSL: We two will live together.

S.FORM: tja qetsiaw anga azua ku vaław a tjaisangas," aya azua vavayan.
tja qeciaw anga azoa ko valjaw a tjaisangas," aya azoa vavayan.
S.TRANSL: We’ll kill my former husband.”

S.FORM: qau "tja kudain a qemtsi, sa ini kełang tu tima a naqemtsi?" aya tiamadju.
qao "tja kodain a qemci, sa ini keljang to tima a naqemci?" aya tiamadjo.
S.TRANSL: “How can we kill him, without it being known who has killed him?” they said.

S.FORM: kiłavaran a vavayan: "azua mapulaw.
kiljavaran a vavayan: "azoa mapolaw.
S.TRANSL: The woman said: “He’s drunk.

S.FORM: tja sialapan tua bungbung, sa pizua-i tua qatjuvi.
tja sialapan toa bongbong, sa pizoa-i toa qatjovi.
S.TRANSL: Let’s take a bamboo tube and put a snake in it.

S.FORM: qau sa tja tsage-i tua sapui a iku nua qatjuvi.
qao sa tja cage-i toa sapoi a iko noa qatjovi.
S.TRANSL: Then let’s heat the snake’s tail with fire;

S.FORM: qau ki mintuluq anga azua qatjuvi a sema tjua tjiał nimadju," aya tiamadju a małavar.
qao ki mintoloq anga azoa qatjovi a sema tjoa tjialj nimadjo," aya tiamadjo a maljavar.
S.TRANSL: and the snake will dart forward into his stomach,” they decided.

S.FORM: qau aitazuain a qemtsi azua vaław a tjaisangas.
qao aitazoain a qemci azoa valjaw a tjaisangas.
S.TRANSL: So that’s how the former husband was killed.

S.FORM: qau a tsaḍ kiqeneqenetj tazua maḍusa a pałetalataladj tua qatjuvi.
qao a cadr kiqeneqenetj tazoa madrosa a paljetalataladj toa qatjovi.
S.TRANSL: Now the thief saw the two putting the snake in.

S.FORM: qau marekutj anga azua tsaḍ tu sika uzai anga tsautsau iqumaqan a namatsay anga.
qao marekotj anga azoa cadr to sika ozai anga caocao iqomaqan a namacay anga.
S.TRANSL: The thief was afraid that there was going to be a dead person in the house,

S.FORM: mintuluq anga łetsasaw.
mintoloq anga ljecasaw.
S.TRANSL: and he dashed outside.

S.FORM: qau małianga; manu kemłang a mamazangiłan tu uzai a namatsay a tsautsau.
qao maljianga; mano kemljang a mamazangiljan to ozai a namacay a caocao.
S.TRANSL: Next day the chief heard that someone had died;

S.FORM: qau vaik a kivadaq tazua vaław a vavayan.
qao vaik a kivadaq tazoa valjaw a vavayan.
S.TRANSL: so he went to ask the wife.

S.FORM: łakua "kemłang (aken) tu tima a naqemtsi" aya maitazua tjemumał.
ljakoa "kemljang (aken) to tima a naqemci" aya maitazoa tjemomalj.
S.TRANSL: But she just said: “How can we (?I) know who killed him?” (?)

S.FORM: manu vaivaik azua mamazangiłan a sema kavuavuan; setsevungan a tsaḍ.
mano vaivaik azoa mamazangiljan a sema kavoavoan; secevongan a cadr.
S.TRANSL: The chief was going to the fields, and he met the thief.

S.FORM: "aku ini su puvałavaław?
"ako ini so povaljavaljaw?
S.TRANSL: “Why don’t you get married?

S.FORM: tiaken a kisan muilang tjanusun," ayain azua tsaḍ.
tiaken a kisan moilang tjanoson," ayain azoa cadr.
S.TRANSL: I’ll act as go-between for you,” he said to the thief.

S.FORM: mintu valisvis azua tsaḍ.
minto valisvis azoa cadr.
S.TRANSL: The thief shook his head.

S.FORM: "marekutj aken a puvaław.
"marekotj aken a povaljaw.
S.TRANSL: “I’m afraid of getting married.

S.FORM: uzai anga ku łinengłengan a pałetalataladjan tua qatjuvi sa patsay anga.
ozai anga ko ljinengljengan a paljetalataladjan toa qatjovi sa pacay anga.
S.TRANSL: I’ve seen someone who had a snake put in him and he died.

S.FORM: avan ku sika rekutj a puvaław," aya zua tsaḍ.
avan ko sika rekotj a povaljaw," aya zoa cadr.
S.TRANSL: That’s why I’m afraid of marrying,” said the thief;

S.FORM: qau sa tjumał tu tima a łinengłengan.
qao sa tjomalj to tima a ljinengljengan.
S.TRANSL: and he told whom he had seen.

S.FORM: qau kemłang anga azua mamazangiłan tu tima.
qao kemljang anga azoa mamazangiljan to tima.
S.TRANSL: So now the chief knew who it was.

S.FORM: qau qetsin anga zua vavayan katua uqałay a łemaḍusa.
qao qecin anga zoa vavayan katoa oqaljay a ljemadrosa.
S.TRANSL: And the woman and the man were both killed.
